content: 5211: Schedule created
I'm setting up an automatic reminder about office hours that posts at 1:00pm (Pacific - USA) every Wednesday.
Office hours officially start in 2 hrs time, but that's when I go to bed. So I'll be around between now and then if anyone needs help/advice with anything...
I guess I didn't realize it started at 4 Eastern, thought it was now or 3. I get confused with all the time zones.
No worries @Justin Keiser. Anything you need help with now, or rather wait for others later?
If you want, I could do it now. That way you could contribute and still get to bed. If I still have questions I could ask the others later.
Sure, what's up?
Since the only drupal/backdrop sites I've ever worked on are mine I just want someone else to look at it. Notably the log messages. I never know if I should worry about them or not.
Ok, I can take a look. Want to PM me the login?
did you folks win @Justin Keiser 's site?
nobody has won yet, is this a screen sharing thing?

Personally, I expect to be online for the next 2 hours and am available to answer any questions I am able to. If I can't answer your question, I can help find someone who is able to answer it.
I guess I found the Office Hours? I didn't really know what it was, I only found out about it at the Virtual Users Group meeting yesterday. I'm curious about how it's been promoted.

We have not widely publicized it, but officially we have office hours posted for every Wednesday in March starting now and lasting for the next 3 hours.
So, if anyone is here for office hours, please say "hello" and let us know how we can help you.
Hello, I'm just working away on a contrib admin theme but can help anyone if/as needed...
(for the next hour until I go sleepy sleep)
Are you willing to troubleshoot my work on Special Menu Items? I'm stuck (again).
@Laryn Is there an issue/PR for me to look at?

I've set up a validation function that runs first (thanks to array_unshift) and it does set the value of the form item (verified by dpming the $form_state)... but I'm still getting "Path field is required." after I submit.

Here's the branch with my work: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/special_menu_items/tree/issue-1

backdrop-contrib/special_menu_items
Enables creating placeholder and separator menu items. - backdrop-contrib/special_menu_items

Here's the issue: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/special_menu_items/issues/1

[UX] provide a "Add non-linkable item" and a "Add separator item" action links instead of special paths. · Issue #1 · backdrop-contrib/special_menu_items
We currently require the user to enter either <nolink> or <separator> as path in order to create the supported special menu items. That is for users that already know how the module wor...

@Laryn I think #states doesn't change the validation of form elements, just how they're presented on the screen. So making a field optional via #states will remove the 'required' asterisk, but it's still required as far as the form's concerned and will fail validation. This is a suspicion, but I think it's backed up by this statement "#states doesn't fundamentally change any of the elements, it just changes their presentation." here: https://randyfay.com/states

A quick welcome to anyone dropping in for the first time to participate in the Backdrop CMS office hours (officially happening for the next two hours). Please, feel free to introduce yourself and ask a question.
I think that may be right. Just pushed another change that seems to work in that regard. Any idea how to find the default value for menu_item_type when editing a menu item?
@Laryn I posted in the issue you mentioned about removing the required status in your validation function. That might do it (not sure though). I'm off to bed now, all the best with it!
Better change it in the form alter itself: $form['whatever']['#required'] = FALSE But then you need to do a validation function to ensure that whatever is never empty.

I didn't realize you guys were doing this again. I've been dealing with things not working for the last few hours. Been looking at a lot of things that say Missing bundle property on entity of type node. Going to try going to a backup of the code base tomorrow. I should take more care in updating modules because they seem to be colliding with one another these days.

We have office hours listed for the month of March (https://backdropcms.org/support/resources) and MIGHT continue with them later ...

But, we should promote them better if we are going to do them.

There was a tweet today: https://twitter.com/backdropcms/status/1237841042151329793

Come join us in our chat channel for our weekly office hours (in March). Open for another 2 hours. Ask anything about Backdrop CMS. https://backdrop.zulipchat.com/

- Backdrop CMS (@backdropcms)
Yeah, I was recording a Podcast and hadn't checked Twitter.

I think my issue has something to do with Paragraphs and modules that were updated recently but I haven't been able to zero in on solving it. I should've gone home a while ago. Probably not going to solve it tonight.

@Laryn @BWPanda (Peter) yes, #states does not play nice with required (see #2732 for one example). Also refer to my comment and PR in #2731: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/pull/2783/files#diff-805bfa8b35104aa06009fc84f21666a5R97-R103

[DX][UX] Form API: Make it so that required fields that are hidden via #states are only validated when visible. · Issue #2732 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Describe your issue or idea Every time that we need to conditionally present a required field in a form, we are forced to either write specific validation functions for that form, or simply settle ...
[UX] Manage blocks UI: No required indicator in "Admin label" field for custom blocks. · Issue #2731 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Describe your issue or idea While creating custom blocks from Structure -> Custom blocks -> Add custom block (/admin/structure/block/add) shows the "Admin label" field as required: ...
Issue #2731: [UX] Manage blocks UI: Add required indicator in "Admin label" field for custom blocks. by klonos · Pull Request #2783 · backdrop/backdrop
Fixes backdrop/backdrop-issues#2731 Replaces #1910

It seems in my testing that perhaps what I've done in CTools conversion is not quite right yet, since the input shows and hides for me, but the label always remains. I'll open it here as a ...

im in

I have difficulties to set up a condition with a data comparison on a date field: The field isn't available as Data selector.
I hate it when that happens. ;-)
I'm pretty sure that not all available options show up in the autocomplete. But, that by itself doesn't help you much.
@Olaf Grabienski what fields do you want to compare?
@mazze.ch I want to compare a date field with the current date (now).
Other fields of the content type in question are available for the Data comparison, e.g. a text field.
What is the "react on event" type? Saving a node?
(I've also setup the conditions "Entity is of bundle" (node type Event) and "Entity has field".)
I haven't added a reaction so far ... because of the difficulties to configure the condition.
... Ah, misunderstood ...
Yes, the "React on event" is "Nach dem Speichern von neuem Inhalt of Typ Termin" (after saving new content of type Event).

@Olaf Grabienski does not seem to work at all, I could easely do it in D7, but not in Backdrop (also tried with all date types). This reminds me at the date filter I wanted to create in Views recently, @BWPanda (Peter) mentioned some date functionality not being migrated into core back then – but could also be something else.... https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/event-list-view-list-filter-months

Hm, really strange: I'm able to

  • select other fields of the content type (text, category, body) for a Data comparison,
  • select the "node created" value for Data comparison,
  • as a test select a non-date field for comparison (Data to compare) and then select the date field as Data value (Value to compare the data with), even if that doesn't make sense.
@mazze.ch Thanks for trying it in D7 vs. Backdrop! I'll have a look at the forum post and the mentioned core issue.

The same here... but works in D7. Maybe someone with better backend skills can tell if this might be the reason https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2766

Restore missing "Page by date" Views pager plugin · Issue #2766 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Date module was merged to Backdrop core in version 1.2.0 For some reason one views pager plugin wasn't ported (date_views\includes\date_views_plugin_pager.inc). I wonder was it intentional or w...
I'm also going to post an issue in the Rules queue (with a link to the core issue) to get more eyes on it.

@StPaulTim cant answer to this here (no permission) https://backdrop.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/218770-Contrib/topic/Geocoding.20form.20address.20field.... Yes I am still having trouble, do you remember the site you did it successfully?
@mazze.ch In D7, did you need one of the conditions "Entity is of type" or "Entity has field" to make the Data comparison work?

Yes, I set a filter for the certain content type (event), indeed it throws an error when removing it...!

Screenshot-2020-04-08-at-23.41.35.png Screenshot-2020-04-08-at-23.41.15.png

advice wanted please. I ported Entity Token module. But just discovered that that module did a str_replace on all field names to change underscores to dashes. On checking, it seems this was a source of contention between D7 Token and Entity Token maintainers. So now a new user of my port (maybe the first user) has complained about the token browser links not working. I've discovered this is because the browser has two copies of all field tokens, one with a name made of underscores, one with dashes, but both would have an ID made of dashes. This is the same in D7 but it caused no proble there, but messes up the JS in Backdrops Treetable implementation
So this would be an opportunity to resolve an old D7 war, and just switch Entity Token to use underscores.
Fixes the token browser issues (I checked)
do it;
but would this cause an issue down the road with people who might have used it in D7
i dunno; is there an upgrade path currently?
didnt see the need; no variables, no settings page

@mazze.ch FYI: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/rules/issues/75

No Data comparison for Date fields · Issue #75 · backdrop-contrib/rules
I have difficulties to set up a Rules condition with a Data comparison on a date field: The field isn't available as Data selector. Steps to reproduce: Create a Rule React on event: After savin...
An explanation for missing date fields in rules and a possible solution has been posted in @Olaf Grabienski s rules issue.

In 1.x-1.x: When configuring a field on a Paragraph type, the "Delete field" button doesn't work: However the dropdown operation button does seem to work on the Paragraph Type's &...

Hello! Office Hours still going? Because I've got a random question

In Drupal 7, for a given text field (say the Body field of a content type) the "Plain Text" format is an option in the "Text format" dropdown for the field; I can choose it on the fly, even for a text field that defaults to a different format (one that uses the WYSIWYG). In Backdrop, a "Plain Text" text exists, but it can't be chosen for text fields that aren't specifically set to be in the Plain Text format.

Does anyone know if there's a good or easy way around that, or a setting I can change somewhere to allow "Plain Text" to show up in the list of Text Formats that can be chosen on the fly for a given text field?
(My use case is kinda random,

I'm using https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/image_field_caption and want to set the default for the image caption field to Plain Text, but I can't because module configures the caption field to use filtered text.)

backdrop-contrib/image_field_caption
Provides a caption text area for image fields. Contribute to backdrop-contrib/image_field_caption development by creating an account on GitHub.

@Jack is it possible what you are experiencing is related to https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4076 ?

User without access to default text format can't edit field · Issue #4076 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the bug If you have a user who doesn't have access to, say, the Full HTML format, and if you set the default text format for a field to Full HTML, then that user cannot edit that...

@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) Nah, that's not what's happening; all users have access to the Plain Text format, and I'm logged in as an admin user; Plain Text just isn't among the formatting options for any fields, neither when using the add/edit content screens nor when configuring the default for the fields
Thank you for the suggestion though! :)

General noob question here. I am using Backdrop for the backend of a site that connects to a smart phone, it needs to send 'realtime' data, or something close enough. The initial dev has a custom site in PHP and was using WebSockets. I dont have much experience with WebSockets myself. Most of my experience has just been in Rest API, however, that will be a lot of requests. Does anyone know if the service module provides any other methods of sending/ recieving data that is easier (in theory) to setup, instead of websockets ?

Hi, Eric Vander Wal. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU
My First time to Zulip, instead of glitter :) . Long time site builder with Drupal (10+ years), doing some projects in backdrop now and finally dipping my feet into PHP (my day dev is in c#, python).
@EricV I'm the opposite: I've been doing PHP since learning Drupal 12 years ago, and am just now starting to learn Python :wink:
I like c# the best. Nice strongly typed language with { } for reading ease. No memory management :) But nothing beat python for data management.

@EricV Most of the real time setups that I have seen seem to use NodeJS to handle the websockets and then use standard HTTP requests into Drupal for the things that don't need to be real time. https://www.drupal.org/project/nodejs
Alternatively, there is https://www.drupal.org/project/websocket, but it only has a Drupal 8 version which would be harder to port to Backdrop.

Alrighty...I made the migration from Gitter. Huzzah. As usual, thanks to the Backdrop team for being so friendly, helpful, and generally awesome. Looking forward to interacting more and more as my projects move off Drupal....

Hi, Bob Christenson. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU
@Joseph Flatt Thanks, I appriciate it. I contacted another more experience dev who has used node.js in the past. So I think that might be the direction I go.
If you want help with porting the Node.JS module to Backdrop, I could take a stab at that. I've never used Node on any real projects, but the module doesn't look too complicated.

Are you guys still doing this? I've had a few issues crop up that I don't understand. All of the buttons are gray on the site despite what they should be in the theme. When I look in the inspector it says, "invalid property value." Also, I disable a module and then uninstall it, however it's still on the List Modules page.
I'm understanding now that the uninstall modules works as intended. https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/uninstalled-modules-are-not-removed But there's that css error.
@Justin Keiser buttons on front end or admin theme? what is the source code (inspect element) look like? what theme?
no-works.JPG works.JPG It's a subtheme of basis but continues to be a problem even when I change the theme.
if you scroll down in that css is there something overriding the background or background-color of the input or button-primary?
also I don't know why one works and one doesn't are they different pages?
Ah yes, that looks different on the sites, but I don't know where it's coming from.
Same page, different versions of the site...on different versions of Backdrop.
also looks like you have CSS caching on and if you are actively changing styles you might want to turn that off whilst you develop
I know I should do that but after clearing cache it's still gray. There it is, don't know where it's coming from. theres-the-gray.JPG
if you turn off caching the css_0Gblalalalslalals.css should give you a better hint as to where it comes from
but with caching on it points to the minimized file
Oh yeah, I saw about this when watching that Drupal 8 Theming class. I've got to change stuff in settings.php, right?
Configuration > Development > Performance
You can turn off caching and aggregation there.
found it, thanks
I can certainly override the gray color, but it should be the color I select in the appearance menu, correct?
I find the #c1c1c1 color is the css files in the color folder but not in the folder for the theme.
is that a color module thing? my subthemes of basis do not have a color directory; if you are not using color module maybe back it up and delete it from the theme?

If the color in the theme's CSS files is not the exact same color that is being referenced by the color module (I believe in color.inc, but @Joseph Flatt probably knows off the top of his head), the colors will not be changed by using the color changer.
@Justin Keiser Which theme are you using as the base for your theme?
tis a subtheme of basis;
I don't know much but I definitely think it's a color module thing. I didn't do anything with the colors in the theme at all. I only upgraded to 1.16.1.
i'd just backup the colors directory move it out of your theme and disable color module

Wonder if this could be a side effect of https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/commit/e322ad78da620654f9fca54d0be43fdab14f7bfb

Issue #4295: Rebuild Color module CSS on cache flush. · backdrop/backdrop@e322ad7
